keep_werror.description: Whether to keep -Werror flags active in package builds

shared_linking.description: Control how shared libraries are located at runtime on Linux

type.description: Whether to use RPATH or RUNPATH for runtime library search paths

bind.description: Embed absolute paths of dependent libraries directly in ELF binaries (experimental)

missing_library_policy.description: How to handle missing dynamic libraries after installation

root.description: The location where Spack will install packages and their dependencies

padded_length.description: Length to pad installation paths to allow better relocation of binaries (true for max length, integer for specific length)

projections.description: Customize directory structure and naming schemes by mapping specs to format strings.

all.description: Default projection format string used as fallback for all specs that do not match other entries. Uses spec format syntax like "{name}/{version}/{hash:16}".

additionalProperties.description: Projection format string for specs matching this key. Uses spec format syntax supporting tokens like {name}, {version}, {compiler.name}, {^dependency.name}, etc.

install_hash_length.description: Length of hash used in installation directory names

build_stage.description: Temporary locations Spack can try to use for builds

stage_name.description: Name format for build stage directories

develop_stage_link.description: Name for development spec build stage directories

test_stage.description: Directory in which to run tests and store test results

extensions.description: List of Spack extensions to load

template_dirs.description: Locations where templates should be found

license_dir.description: Directory where licenses should be located

source_cache.description: Location to cache downloaded tarballs and repositories

misc_cache.description: Temporary directory to store long-lived cache files, such as indices of packages

environments_root.description: Directory where Spack managed environments are created and stored

connect_timeout.description: Abort downloads after this many seconds if no data is received (0 disables timeout)

verify_ssl.description: When true, Spack will verify certificates of remote hosts when making SSL connections

ssl_certs.description: Path to custom certificates for SSL verification

suppress_gpg_warnings.description: Suppress GPG warnings from binary package verification

debug.description: Enable debug mode for additional logging

checksum.description: When true, Spack verifies downloaded source code using checksums

deprecated.description: If true, Spack will fetch deprecated versions without warning

locks.description: When true, concurrent instances of Spack will use locks to avoid conflicts (strongly recommended)

dirty.description: When true, builds will NOT clean potentially harmful variables from the environment

build_language.description: The language the build environment will use (C for English, empty string for user's environment)

build_jobs.description: The maximum number of jobs to use for the build system (e.g. make -j), defaults to 16

concurrent_packages.description: The maximum number of concurrent package builds a single Spack instance will run

ccache.description: When true, Spack's compiler wrapper will use ccache when compiling C and C++

db_lock_timeout.description: How long to wait to lock the Spack installation database

package_lock_timeout.description: How long to wait when attempting to modify a package (null for never timeout)

allow_sgid.description: Allow installation on filesystems that don't allow setgid bit manipulation

install_status.description: Whether to show status information in the terminal title during the build

url_fetch_method.description: The default URL fetch method to use (urllib or curl)

additional_external_search_paths.description: Additional paths to search for external packages

binary_index_ttl.description: Number of seconds a buildcache's index.json is cached locally before probing for updates

aliases.description: A mapping of aliases that can be used to define new Spack commands

installer.description: Which installer to use. The new installer is experimental.
